result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S. Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S. Knight

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

11:31 am Defendant Michael S. Knight in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend to misdemeanor disorderly conduct - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Cirilli/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Fine - $263.50

Appeal rights given. Payment plan application.
Adj. 11:38
  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:03 p.m. Defendant Michael S. Knight in court with attorney Gary Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CIrilli statement that case has not been resolved - just received restitution information today. Bail continued. Adj. 2:04 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.

3:30 p.m. Defendant Michael S. Knight in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held off record - pre-trial  continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Response to State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

11:10 a.m. Defendant Michael S. Knight in court.  Michael Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement that he had spoken with defendant re resolution - received phone call this morning from Attorney Cirilli - waiting for retainer to be paid. Defendant states he first contacted Attorney Cirilli 3 weeks ago - Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:26 p.m Defendant Michael S. Knight in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig states there was some discussion regarding resolution - Victim contacted DA's office regarding restitution - DA requests additional time to determine restitution amount and extent of medical issues of victim - Bail continued. Adj. 3:29 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 11:00 am.

3:03 p.m. Defendant Michael S. Knight in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he did not qualify for PD - can't afford attorney - will represent himself and speak to DA's office.  Court reads on waiver of counsel - Waiver free and voluntary - defendant pleads not guilty. Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm. Adj. 3:05 p.m.
No intoxicants, no taverns.  No contact with Lawrence D. Watkins.

1:51 p.m Defendant Michael S. Knight in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel, Schiek  statement to bail - Court sets $  bond  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
